content: On October 29, 1995, the Atlanta Braves clinched their first World Series title since moving to Atlanta by defeating the Cleveland Indians in Game 6 of the series. The Braves won 1-0, thanks to a stellar performance by pitcher Tom Glavine, who threw eight scoreless innings, and a crucial RBI single from David Justice. This victory marked the culmination of a dominant season, solidifying the Braves' place in baseball history.
